abstract: Pres Obama says he will continue fighting for trans-Pacific trade deal, despite growing criticism and opposition from both Hillary Rodham Clinton and Donald Trump, saying agreement is essential for America to thrive in global economy.

headline.print_headline: Obama Vows to Defend Trans-Pacific Trade Accord
headline.main: Obama Defends Trans-Pacific Deal Against Strong Anti-Trade Tide

snippet: Facing opposition from both candidates who want to succeed him, the president vowed to keep pressing for the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership, citing its strategic importance....
lead_paragraph: Facing opposition from both candidates who want to succeed him, the president vowed to keep pressing for the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership, citing its strategic importance.
